comments:
Using I20061121-1845, I cannot open a JUnit test by clicking on a failing test in the JUnit view. Setting as blocker since this makes it really paintful to use the  JUnit tests.

This might be a bug in JUnit. If this is the case, please let them know asap.

Markus,
it works for me using I20061121-1845 + file:////home/smboti/t/jabiru/plugin-export/I20061121-1845.from20061122_1744.zip
I also cannot reproduce, and I don't see how this could happen from looking at the code. Olivier, can you reproduce? Is your setup somehow unusual (e.g. multiple windows, single click mode, ...)?
Most of the times it works fine. But once it failed, I have to restart Eclipse.

Found it. Looks like a missing SWT event. I don't get a shellClosed(..) message when the shell is disposed via Shell#dispose(). This happens when you click the OK button to close the comparison dialog.

Fixed in HEAD.

Workaround is to close the dialog via close box or Esc key (or to simply leave the dialog open, since it is not modal any more ;-).

What plugin do I need to update?
I'd like to get rid of this error.
Thanks.
*** Bug 165687 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
